block.p: Ann Elena Gillick and Michael Gregory Duffy were married yesterday at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Manhasset, N.Y. Msgr. Thomas Hartman performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Duffy is the director of admissions and financial aid at Friends Academy in Locust Valley, N.Y. She graduated cum laude from Colgate University and received a Master of Education degree in counseling and student personnel from the University of Maryland. She is the daughter of Eleanor Principe of Oyster Bay Cove, N.Y., and the late William Vitiello, and the stepdaughter of Joseph Principe. The bride's father owned Ameliart Embroidery, which was in Manhattan.
Ann Elena Gillick and Michael Gregory Duffy were married yesterday at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Manhasset, N.Y. Msgr. Thomas Hartman performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Duffy is the director of admissions and financial aid at Friends Academy in Locust Valley, N.Y. She graduated cum laude from Colgate University and received a Master of Education degree in counseling and student personnel from the University of Maryland. She is the daughter of Eleanor Principe of Oyster Bay Cove, N.Y., and the late William Vitiello, and the stepdaughter of Joseph Principe. The bride's father owned Ameliart Embroidery, which was in Manhattan.

Mr. Duffy is a vice president for operations at ABC News in Manhattan. He graduated from Cornell. He is a son of Dr. Marjorie Duffy of Manhasset and the late Anthony W. Duffy. His mother retired as a child psychologist at Little Flower Children's Services, an adoption agency in Wading River, N.Y., and Brooklyn. His father was a partner in Dell-Duffy Photography, which was in Manhattan.
The bride was a widow and the bridegroom a widower.
